Video File :

second.jsp<%String fileLocation="D://";if(ServletFileUpload.isMultipartContent(request)){ try { List multiparts = new ServletFileUpload(new DiskFileItemFactory()).parseRequest(request); for (FileItem item : multiparts) { if (item.isFormField()) { String fieldName = item.getFieldName(); String fieldValue = item.getString(); } else { String fieldName = item.getFieldName(); String fileName = FilenameUtils.getName(item.getName()); InputStream fileContent = item.getInputStream(); String name = new File(item.getName()).getName(); item.write( new File(fileLocation + File.separator + name)); } } System.out.println("File Uploaded Successfully"); } catch (Exception ex) { System.out.println("File Upload Failed due to " + ex); }}%>Error i am getting is: i am getting following error in consoleFile Upload Failed due to org.apache.commons.fileupload.FileUploadException: the request was rejected because no multipart boundary was found Please using this api: Iterator.next. Question: File upload using JSP and Jquery: :I got a requirement where i need submit a form which contains file input asynchronously using ajax. Following is the code i written. but it is giving me error.Input.jsp:
Slide Name :
Video File :
Some input : Yes No
second.jsp<%String fileLocation="D://";if(ServletFileUpload.isMultipartContent(request)){ try { List multiparts = new ServletFileUpload(new DiskFileItemFactory()).parseRequest(request); for (FileItem item : multiparts) { if (item.isFormField()) { String fieldName = item.getFieldName(); String fieldValue = item.getString(); } else { String fieldName = item.getFieldName(); String fileName = FilenameUtils.getName(item.getName()); InputStream fileContent = item.getInputStream(); String name = new File(item.getName()).getName(); item.write( new File(fileLocation + File.separator + name)); } } System.out.println("File Uploaded Successfully"); } catch (Exception ex) { System.out.println("File Upload Failed due to " + ex); }}%>Error i am getting is: i am getting following error in consoleFile Upload Failed due to org.apache.commons.fileupload.FileUploadException: the request was rejected because no multipart boundary was found Please using this api: Iterator.next. Answer: The error is because the request is not being sent as multipart/form-data. The contentType in the ajax call should be set to "multipart/form-data". <<>>: ```javascript function fileUpload(){ var formData = $('#myform').serialize(); $.ajax({ type: "POST", url: "second.jsp", async: true, data: formData, contentType: "multipart/form-data", processData: false, success: function(msg) { alert("File has been uploaded successfully"); }, error:function(msg) { alert("Failed to upload file"); } }); } ``` <<>>: The contentType in the ajax call should be set to "multipart/form-data". This tells the server that the request is a multipart request and the data is being sent in parts. The serialize function is used to serialize the form data into a URL-encoded string. Please note that the 'processData' option is set to false. This is because we are sending the form data as is, not processing it. If it was set to true, jQuery would try to process the form data and convert it into a query string, which would not work for file uploads. The 'async' option is set to true, meaning the request is sent asynchronously. This means the page will not wait for the server to respond before continuing, improving the performance of the web page. The 'success' and 'error' callbacks are used to handle the response from the server. If the file upload is successful, the success callback is called, otherwise the error callback is called. The 'type' option is set to "POST", meaning the data is sent to the server using the HTTP POST method. The 'url' option is set to "second.jsp", meaning the request is sent to this JSP page on the server. The 'data' option is set to formData, which contains the serialized form data. The 'fileUpload' function is called when the submit button is clicked. It serializes the form data and sends it to the server using an AJAX POST request. The second.jsp page is the server-side page that handles the file upload. It checks if the request is a multipart request using ServletFileUpload.isMultipartContent. If it is, it parses the request and writes the file data to a file. If there is an error, it prints the error message to the console. <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|> <|EOT|>
